target_content: Food security: Ensuring food security and access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food for all.
justification: The reduction of food waste per capita, as targeted by TA3.25, can contribute to ensuring food security and access to quality food, as targeted by TA5.32, by reducing the amount of food that is wasted and making more food available for consumption. This can have a positive impact on TA5.32.

target_content: Food security: Ensuring food security and access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food for all.
justification: The implementation of TA3.27, which aims to make all packaging recyclable, may have a negative impact on TA5.32 if the focus on recyclability leads to increased food packaging and subsequently more food waste, rather than reducing waste and increasing food security.

target_content: Nutrition and healthy, sustainable diets: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets.
justification: The reduction of food waste per capita, as targeted by TA3.25, can contribute to promoting healthier and more sustainable diets, as targeted by TA5.33, by reducing the amount of unhealthy and unsustainable food that is wasted and making more healthy and sustainable food options available for consumption.

target_content: Health impact of diets: Reversing of the rise in overweight and obesity rates across the EU by 2030.
justification: The implementation of TA3.28, which aims to increase the use of recycled plastic in packaging, may have a negative impact on TA5.34 if the increased use of plastic packaging leads to increased consumption of unhealthy and high-calorie foods, contributing to overweight and obesity rates.

target_content: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EUâ€™s land area.
justification: The protection of 30% of the EU's land area, as targeted by TA6.1, can contribute to reducing waste and increasing recycling rates, as targeted by TA3.30, by preserving natural habitats and ecosystems that help to maintain soil health and reduce waste.

target_content: 1.b Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's sea area.
justification: The protection of 30% of the EU's sea area, as targeted by TA6.2, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.31, by preserving marine ecosystems and promoting sustainable fishing and aquaculture practices.

target_content: 2.a Strictly protect at least a third of the EU'S protected areas.
justification: The strict protection of protected areas, as targeted by TA6.3, may have a negative impact on TA3.32 if the protection of these areas leads to increased costs and complexity for recycling and waste management operations, making it more difficult to achieve the recycling targets.

target_content: 2b. Strictly protect all remaining EU primary and old-growth forests.
justification: The protection of primary and old-growth forests, as targeted by TA6.4, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.33, by preserving natural carbon sinks and promoting sustainable forestry practices.

target_content: 4. By 2030, significant areas of degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems are restored.
justification: The restoration of degraded ecosystems, as targeted by TA6.7, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.34, by promoting sustainable land use and ecosystem services that help to maintain soil health and reduce waste.

target_content: 5. The decline of pollinators is reversed.
justification: The reversal of pollinator decline, as targeted by TA6.8, may have a negative impact on TA3.35 if the increased use of pollinators leads to increased demand for aluminum and other metals used in packaging, making it more difficult to achieve the recycling targets.

target_content: 6. The risk and use of chemical pesticides is reduced by 50%, and the use of more hazardous pesticides is reduced by 50%.
justification: The reduction of chemical pesticide use, as targeted by TA6.9, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.36, by promoting sustainable agriculture practices and reducing the amount of hazardous waste generated by pesticide use.

target_content: 7. At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features.
justification: The promotion of high-diversity landscape features, as targeted by TA6.10, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.37, by promoting sustainable agriculture practices and reducing the amount of waste generated by agricultural activities.

target_content: 9. Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles.
justification: The planting of three billion trees, as targeted by TA6.11, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.38, by promoting sustainable forestry practices and reducing the amount of waste generated by forestry activities.

target_content: 11. At least 25.000 km of free-flowing rivers are restored.
justification: The restoration of free-flowing rivers, as targeted by TA6.13, may have a negative impact on TA3.39 if the restoration of rivers leads to increased costs and complexity for waste management operations, making it more difficult to achieve the recycling targets.

target_content: 12. There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by Invasive Alien Species (IAS).
justification: The reduction of IAS, as targeted by TA6.14, can contribute to increasing recycling rates and reducing waste, as targeted by TA3.40, by promoting sustainable ecosystem services and reducing the amount of waste generated by invasive species.

target_content: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials, 50% for lithium, no later than 31 December 2027
justification: The increased demand for lithium, as targeted by TA3.23, may have a negative impact on TA5.32 if the extraction and processing of lithium leads to environmental degradation and health risks, compromising food security and access to quality food.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
justification: The reduction of food waste, as targeted by TA3.24, can contribute to promoting healthier and more sustainable diets, as targeted by TA5.33, by reducing the amount of unhealthy and unsustainable food that is wasted and making more healthy and sustainable food options available for consumption.

target_content: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
justification: The reduction of food waste per capita, as targeted by TA3.25, can contribute to reversing the rise in overweight and obesity rates, as targeted by TA5.34, by reducing the amount of unhealthy and high-calorie food that is wasted and making more healthy and sustainable food options available for consumption.

target_content: All packaging shall be recyclable
justification: The implementation of TA3.27, which aims to make all packaging recyclable, may have a negative impact on TA6.1 if the focus on recyclability leads to increased packaging and subsequently more waste, rather than reducing waste and promoting sustainable land use.

target_content: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste
justification: The increased use of recycled plastic in packaging, as targeted by TA3.28, can contribute to protecting at least 30% of the EU's sea area, as targeted by TA6.2, by reducing the amount of plastic waste that enters the ocean and promoting sustainable packaging practices.

target_content: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags
justification: The reduction of lightweight plastic carrier bags, as targeted by TA3.29, may have a negative impact on TA6.3 if the reduction of plastic bags leads to increased use of other materials, such as paper or cotton, which may have higher environmental impacts and compromise the protection of protected areas.

target_content: Each Member State shall reduce the packaging waste generated per capita, as compared to the packaging waste generated per capita in 2018
justification: The reduction of packaging waste per capita, as targeted by TA3.30, can contribute to strictly protecting all remaining EU primary and old-growth forests, as targeted by TA6.4, by reducing the amount of waste generated by packaging and promoting sustainable forestry practices.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain the recycling targets of 65% by weight of all packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.31, can contribute to restoring significant areas of degraded and carbon-rich ecosystems, as targeted by TA6.7, by reducing the amount of waste that enters the environment and promoting sustainable ecosystem services.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of plastic by weight of plastic contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of plastic packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.32, may have a negative impact on TA6.8 if the focus on plastic recycling leads to increased use of pesticides and other chemicals, compromising the decline of pollinators.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 25% of wood by weight of wood contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of wood packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.33, can contribute to reducing the risk and use of chemical pesticides, as targeted by TA6.9, by promoting sustainable forestry practices and reducing the amount of waste generated by wood packaging.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of ferrous metals by weight of ferrous metals contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of ferrous metals, as targeted by TA3.34, can contribute to increasing the area under high-diversity landscape features, as targeted by TA6.10, by reducing the amount of waste generated by ferrous metal packaging and promoting sustainable agriculture practices.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 50% of aluminum by weight of aluminum contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of aluminum packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.35, may have a negative impact on TA6.11 if the focus on aluminum recycling leads to increased energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions, compromising the planting of three billion trees.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 70% of glass by weight of glass contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of glass packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.36, can contribute to restoring at least 25,000 km of free-flowing rivers, as targeted by TA6.13, by reducing the amount of waste that enters the environment and promoting sustainable ecosystem services.

target_content: Member States shall take the necessary measures to attain a recycling target of 75% of paper and cardboard by weight of paper and cardboard contained in packaging waste generated by 31 December 2025
justification: The increased recycling rate of paper and cardboard packaging waste, as targeted by TA3.37, can contribute to reducing the number of Red List species threatened by Invasive Alien Species, as targeted by TA6.14, by reducing the amount of waste that enters the environment and promoting sustainable ecosystem services.

target_content: Each vehicle belonging to a vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of this Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall be constructed so that it is:
justification: The increased demand for critical raw materials, as targeted by TA3.38, may have a negative impact on TA5.32 if the extraction and processing of these materials leads to environmental degradation and health risks, compromising food security and access to quality food.

target_content: The plastic contained in each vehicle type that is type-approved as of [the first day of the month following 72 months after the date of entry into force of the Regulation] under Regulation (EU) 2018/858 shall contain a minimum of 25% of plastic recycled by weight from post-consumer plastic waste
justification: The increased use of recycled plastic in vehicles, as targeted by TA3.48, can contribute to protecting at least 30% of the EU's land area, as targeted by TA6.1, by reducing the amount of plastic waste that enters the environment and promoting sustainable packaging practices.

target_content: At least 25% of the target set out in the first subparagraph shall be achieved by including plastics recycled from end-of-life vehicles in the vehicle type concerned.
justification: The increased use of recycled plastic from end-of-life vehicles, as targeted by TA3.49, can contribute to protecting at least 30% of the EU's sea area, as targeted by TA6.2, by reducing the amount of plastic waste that enters the ocean and promoting sustainable packaging practices.

target_content: Member States shall ensure that the following targets are met by the waste management operators:
justification: The implementation of TA3.50, which aims to increase the recycling rate of waste, may have a negative impact on TA6.3 if the focus on recycling leads to increased costs and complexity for waste management operations, making it more difficult to protect protected areas.
